method.name: PUT
method.doc: To update the FIPS Mode configuration, issue a PUT request to the FIPS Mode endpoint.
Note that FIPS configuration can only be set during the First Steps Setup process.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: tlsv10Enabled
param.doc: Allow TLS v1.0 for LMI sessions

param.name: tlsv11Enabled
param.doc: Allow TLS v1.1 for LMI sessions

response.doc: Note that if FIPS is being enabled, reboot will be returned as true. If reboot is true, the security appliance must be rebooted to start in FIPS mode. You must perform this reboot before continuing with the First Steps setup process. See the topic "Rebooting and enabling the FIPS Mode configuration" to perform the apply and reboot operation.

param.name: tlsv10Enabled
param.doc: Allow TLS v1.0 for LMI sessions

param.name: tlsv11Enabled
param.doc: Allow TLS v1.1 for LMI sessions

param.name: reboot
param.doc: If this value is true, the security appliance must perform an apply and reboot operation to start in FIPS Mode.

response.doc: The First Steps setup has already been completed. FIPS mode can only be configured during the First Steps setup process.
FIPS mode has already been enabled and the request was attempting to disable FIPS mode. FIPS cannot be disabled once enabled.
An internal error occurred when retrieving the FIPS configuration.
